intro: Draba qinghaiensis, commonly known as the Qinghai draba, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai region of China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants known for their cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often found in rocky soils at high elevations. Draba qinghaiensis is adapted to cold climates and is a typical example of the flora found in the Tibetan Plateau region.
